name: JUMBO Seafood
description: Known for their classic chilli crab, this specialty seafood restaurant serves a variety of live seafood dishes prepared in familiar local and Hong Kong styles.
address: 20 Upper Circular Road, #B1-48 The Riverwalk, Singapore 058416

name: Song Fa Bak Kut Teh
description: An affordable spot for tender pork ribs cooked in a clear, peppery Teochew-style soup, along with an assortment of braised side dishes. Free soup refills available.

name: JAAN by Kirk Westaway
description: Perched on the 70th floor of one of Asia's tallest hotels, JAAN by Kirk Westaway showcases British dining in a refreshing new light with seasonal ingredients from the world's best gourmet producers.
address: Level 70 Swiss√¥tel The Stamford, 2 Stamford Road, Singapore 178882
opening hours: LUNCH Mon-Sat: 11:45am-1pm DINNER Mon-Sat: 6:45pm-8pm Closed on Sundays & Public Holidays

name: CHIJMES
description: A dining complex of restaurants, cafes and bars specialising in diverse cuisines like Japanese, Balinese, Western, Brazilian, and more. Housed in the second oldest colonial building in Singapore.
opening hours: Opening hours vary across various establishments

name: Annalakshmi Restaurant
description: A pay-as-you-wish vegetarian Indian buffet restaurant, run by volunteers for over 17 years. All proceeds go to charitable causes.

name: Shinji by Kanesaka
description: An offshoot of award-winning Chef Shinji Kanesaka's 1 Michelin Star sushi restaurant in the glitzy Ginza district of Tokyo, Shinji by Kanesaka features an ever-changing omakase menu and Edomae-style sushi.
address: 76 Bras Basah Road, Lobby Floor, Carlton Hotel Singapore, Singapore 189558
opening hours: LUNCH Mon-Sat: 12pm-3pm (last order at 2pm) DINNER Mon-Sat: 6pm-10pm (last order at 9pm) Closed on Sundays

name: Maxwell Food Centre
description: A go-to food centre loved by locals and tourists for affordable and authentic hawker fare. Particularly wellknown for Tian Tian Chicken Rice, whose head chef beat Gordon Ramsay in a cook-off in 2013.
opening hours: 8am-2am daily Opening hours vary across individual stalls

name: Bao Makers
description: This quaint dining concept specialises in traditional steamed Chinese buns, filled with a cohesive selection of local and international flavours.
opening hours: LUNCH Mon-Sat: 12pm-3pm DINNER Mon-Thu: 6pm-10pm; Fri-Sat: 6pm-11pm Closed on Sundays
